Authors:
Subodini Nuwanthika Wijesinghe, Yong Wang, Erio Camporesi,
Dhanushka Nadeeshan Wanasinghe, Saranyaphat Boonmee, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
A new genus of Bambusicolaceae (Pleosporales) on Corylus
avellana (Fagales) from Italy
Abstract:
In this study, we introduce Corylicola gen. nov., in the
family of Bambusicolaceae (Pleosporales), to accommodate Corylicola
italica sp. nov. This novel taxon was isolated from dead branches of
Corylus avellana (common hazel) in Italy. The discovery of this new
genus with both sexual and asexual characters will contribute to expand
the knowledge and taxonomic framework of Bambusicolaceae.Corylicola gen.
nov. shares similar morphological characters to species of
Bambusicolaceae in having solitary, scattered, globose to subglobose and
ostiolate ascomata, anastomosing and branching pseudoparaphyses,
cylindrical asci with a well-developed ocular chamber and short furcate
pedicel and 1-septate ascospores. The coelomycetous asexual morph of
Corylicola gen. nov.has holoblastic, phialidic conidiogenous cells and
light brown conidia similar to species of Bambusicolaceae. Corylicola
gen. nov. differs from the other genera of Bambusicolaceae in having
yellowish brown ascospores masses at the top of ascomatal neck. Detailed
morphological illustrations with comprehensive descriptions for the
novel taxon and key to genera of Bambusicolaceae are provided. Maximum
likelihood analysis and Bayesian phylogenetic inference of a combined
SSU, LSU, ITS, RPB2 and TEF1 sequence dataset confirmed its placement as
a distinct lineage in Bambusicolaceae.
